meanings.definition: To remove polish or shine from a surface.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours depolishing the antique silver to give it a more rustic look.
meanings.sent2: After depolishing the wooden table, it had a dull appearance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy enjoyed depolishing the shiny floor with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds depolished the once gleaming windows, leaving them streaked and dull.
meanings.sent5: The artist deliberately depolished the sculpture to create a weathered effect.

meanings.definition: The act of making something less polished or refined.
meanings.sent1: The depolishing of the silverware gave it a more vintage look.
meanings.sent2: His depolishing of the speech made it more relatable to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The depolishing of the fancy car made it blend in with the older models on the street.
meanings.sent4: The depolishing of her manners shocked the refined guests at the party.
meanings.sent5: The depolishing of the diamond ring reduced its sparkle but added character.
